alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Northwest Pinal County; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek; Superior; Tonto Basin (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 8:49AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gila, Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 930 AM MST... At 849 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Queen Valley, or 10 miles southeast of Gold Canyon, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Superior, Queen Creek, Florence Junction, Queen Valley, Magma, Boyce Thompson Arboretum, San Tan Valley and Top-Of-The-World. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 205 and 239. AZ Route 79 between mile markers 143 and 150. AZ Route 177 between mile markers 164 and 167. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Northwest Pinal County; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek; Superior; Tonto Basin
